Key Match Events: The Knicks outscored the Thunder 36-21 in the second quarter with strong defense and ball movement.
OKC outscored New York 63-41 in the second half to secure a 117-107 victory.
Jalen Brunson scored 22 points but missed all five three-point attempts and had two costly fourth-quarter turnovers.
Aaron Wiggins scored 19 points off the bench for the Thunder, contributing significantly in the fourth quarter.
All five Knicks starters scored in double figures, with Brunson, OG Anunoby, and Mikal Bridges each scoring 20 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks entered the game with a nine-game winning streak, while the Thunder had a 13-game winning streak.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks' second quarter success was not sustained in the second half.
Jalen Brunson's individual efforts were seen as detrimental to the team's overall performance.
Tom Thibodeau's limited use of the bench was highlighted as a factor in the loss.
